question: In some areas of the US, a curfew is imposed, in which teenagers are not allowed to be out of doors after a particular time at night unless they are accompanied by an adult.
text: Teenage  is the most vulnerable and important phase of life. To protect teens, the state has deployed a curfew in some areas and adolescents must be accompanied by an adult if they still want to go out. I partially agree with the aforementioned for the reasons that are explained in the following paragraphs.

To begin with, the elevation of crime scene and drug lords are proliferating at an alarming rate; strict actions and close watch on these criminal  are demanded in a bid to alleviate them. Thereby,    by viewing all the circumstances, the authorities ordered curfew in some place to shield  the teens from such kinds of offences. Apart from that, some youngster gets drug addicted under the impression of offenders. For instance, adolescents have frail minds and can swayed easily in any direction, if youngsters are exposed to criminals, then it is almost arduous to get back them in the regular life. Thus, to ensure the safety of young people, the government imposed restrictions on late night outings for them.

Moving further, teenage above certain age limit are allowed to work to bear their expanses; they have to step outside according to their work schedule. Therefore, in such scenarios, the parents or other adult members of the family make sure to give company to their younger in order to save them from any mishaps.

To conclude then, undoubtedly, to ensure the safety of citizens is the prime liability of the authorities. Putting curfew in some places is just a active action of the government to curb offenders and protect their teens from falling in the trap of the wrongdoers.

error_list.error_des: The noun phrase crime scene seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
It seems that scene may not agree in number with other words in this phrase.
It appears that the plural demonstrative these is modifying the singular noun criminal. Consider using a singular demonstrative or a plural noun instead.
The noun phrase curfew seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
The word some place seems to be miswritten. Consider replacing it.
It appears that drug addicted is missing a hyphen. Consider adding the hyphen(s).
The verb swayed after the modal verb can does not appear to be in the correct form. Consider changing the verb form.
It seems that article use may be incorrect here.
The word teenage doesn’t seem to fit this context. Consider replacing it with a different one.
It seems that article use may be incorrect here.
The verb are does not seem to agree with the subject. Consider changing the verb form.
The word expanses doesn’t seem to fit this context. Consider replacing it with a different one.
The word expanses doesn’t seem to fit this context. Consider replacing it with a different one.
To ensure doesn’t seem to work here.
The article a may be incorrect. Consider changing it to agree with the beginning sound of the following word active.
It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
